SEARCH
Package fr.esiee.baba.view

Class View

java.lang.Object
fr.esiee.baba.view.View
public class View extends Object
Manages the graphical display of the game board in "BABA IS YOU". This class handles drawing game elements and the board itself on the screen.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    View(int xOrigin, int yOrigin, int height, int width, int blockSize, List<List<Cellule>> grid)
    Creates a View instance to manage how the game's grid is displayed on the screen.

    Renders the game board on the application's display area.
    static View

  • Constructor Details

    • View

      public View(int xOrigin, int yOrigin, int height, int width, int blockSize, List<List<Cellule>> grid)
      Creates a View instance to manage how the game's grid is displayed on the screen.
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the x-coordinate of the origin of the game board on the screen
      yOrigin - the y-coordinate of the origin of the game board on the screen
      height - the total height of the display area for the game
      width - the total width of the display area for the game
      blockSize - the size of each block representing a single cell on the game board
      grid - the grid containing all the cell elements to be displayed

  • Method Details

    • initGameGraphics

      public static View initGameGraphics(List<List<Cellule>> grid, int height, int width)
      Initializes the View instance with calculated dimensions based on the grid size and screen dimensions.
      Parameters:
      grid - the game grid to be displayed
      height - the total height of the screen
      width - the total width of the screen
      Returns:
      the initialized View object configured for displaying the game

    • draw

      public static void draw(com.github.forax.zen.ApplicationContext context, List<List<Cellule>> grid, View view)
      Renders the game board on the application's display area. This is the main method used to update the graphical display of the game.
      Parameters:
      context - the application context used for handling the rendering
      grid - the grid to be displayed
      view - the View object managing the drawing parameters and operations
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the parameters are null
